about_the_game:
Welcome to the School of Magic

Welcome to the School of Magic, whispered your reflection as you found yourself unexpectedly transported to its mystical realm. Here, amidst the swirling mists of uncertainty, you stand at the threshold of an extraordinary journey, where the secrets of arcane power await your discovery.

Combat

Embark on a journey through the hallowed halls of the School of Magic, where you confront hordes of orcs, skeletons, and otherworldly foes in intense battles of spellcasting mastery. With every incantation and magical gesture, you inch closer to mastering the art of combat and harnessing the raw power of the elements.

Explore

Venture deeper into the labyrinthine corridors, faced with not only physical obstacles but also moral dilemmas that test the very essence of your being. Each decision you make resonates within the ancient walls, shaping your destiny and guiding your path through the enigmatic mysteries of the school.

Strategize

As challenges mount and adversaries grow stronger, the complexity of your decisions becomes paramount. With each spell you acquire, carefully weigh its pros and cons, considering how it integrates with your existing arsenal to form a formidable strategy. Your intellect and intuition will be your greatest assets as you navigate the intricate web of magic that surrounds you.

Rinse and Repeat

In moments of setback and defeat, find solace in the knowledge that failure is but a stepping stone on the path to mastery. Return to the sanctum of the School of Magic, where you refine your skills and expand your repertoire of spells. Armed with newfound wisdom and resilience, emerge once more to face the challenges that lie ahead, for it is through perseverance and determination that true greatness is achieved.

FAQ

  • Does this game use AI?
    Yes, AI is used for art (Adobe Firefly), voice-overs (Eleven Labs), and narrative help (ChatGPT). For more information on my views about AI, visit my website.

  • Is this game really a deckbuilding game?
    The term deckbuilding as it is commonly used in video games seems to be quite fitting, but instead of playing cards for combat, you have real-time Hack and Slash combat. If you are a board game player, the more appropriate term would be drafting.

  • How many people are working on this game?
    The game is being developed only by me (Nikolas Crisci).

This game collects the following Data: When you start and stop playing the game, which cards you pick, which dialog options you pick when you die, your country, and the version of the game. I use the data to improve the game and it is shared only with unity. If you have any questions you can contact me at parttimeindie@gmail.com.
